description: NCP chief Ajit Pawar has officially declared that his party and NCP (SP) will unite for the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation elections.  Addressing a rally, Pawar confirmed the alliance, stating it's a family coming together for the greater good of Maharashtra. Seat-sharing details are expected within two days, signaling a significant political consolidation.

Mexico: 13 killed, over 100 injured after train derails; videos show scenes of chaos
description: A tragic derailment of the Interoceanic Train in southern Mexico has claimed at least 13 lives and injured 98 passengers. The accident occurred near Nizanda, halting vital rail traffic connecting the Pacific and Gulf coasts. Inaugurated last year, the train is a key part of Mexico's ambitious plan to develop the Isthmus of Tehuantepec into a major trade corridor.

'Dhurandhar' collection: Film breaks 'Pushpa 2' record to score highest 4th week collections
description: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office dominance, shattering records even in its fourth weekend. The film garnered an impressive Rs 57.75 crore over the weekend, pushing its total net collection to an estimated Rs 690.50 crore.  'Dhurandhar' has now secured the highest fourth-week collection for any Hindi film, surpassing 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2'.

title: What is a frequency comb?
Trump says, ‘Russia wanted Ukraine to succeed' in front of Zelenskyy — watch his reaction
description: President Trump stated Russia desires Ukraine's success, even offering low-cost energy, a remark that visibly surprised and amused President Zelenskyy. The two leaders met at Mar-a-Lago to discuss peace talks, though their underlying relationship dynamics remained unchanged.

title: Burnt face, bound limbs: Woman found murdered, stuffed in bag at Noida dumping yard
description: An unsettling discovery has shaken Noida's Sector 142, where the lifeless body of an unidentified woman was found, bound and burned, in a refuse site. Local law enforcement is facing hurdles in identifying the young victim, likely in her early twenties, largely due to sparse surveillance in the isolated area.

title: Awakening through Tiruppavai
What we heard from Trump–Zelenskyy meeting: progress claimed but key issues still open
Pink Saheli card: Delhi Aadhaar mandatory for free bus rides for women in 2026
description: Starting January, Delhi's Pink Saheli card initiative will grant women free access to public bus rides, striving for enhanced transparency and convenience. Women aged 12 and over who call Delhi home will utilize this modern smart card, which replaces traditional paper tickets.

title: BJP: Congress has become asset of 'fake' Gandhis; Kharge a 'remote-controlled' politician
description: The BJP on Sunday accused the Congress of becoming a private asset of the "fake" Gandhi family, mocking its president Mallikarjun Kharge as "remote-controlled." BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia listed historical events like the Emergency and anti-Sikh riots as the Congress's legacy, alleging the party now champions corruption and dynastic politics.

title: Chennai Corporation to begin daily bulk waste collection on February 1
Ind vs SL: Smriti Mandhana scripts history; joins elite club to become the fastest to…
description: Smriti Mandhana achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second Indian woman to score over 10,000 international runs. She reached this landmark during the T20I against Sri Lanka. Mandhana's career includes impressive statistics across all formats. She also holds records in T20Is and ODIs. Following the T20I series, she will captain Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the Women's Premier League.

title: Delhi AQI edges closer to ‘severe’, orange alert for fog today
'Jassi bhai itna deep chale gaye': Axar Patel reveals Jasprit Bumrah's perfume obsession
description: Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has a surprising passion for perfumes. Teammate Axar Patel shared that Bumrah is deeply involved in understanding perfume composition. Bumrah even gifted a perfume to Siraj after a match. Patel also received a perfume gift from Bumrah. These anecdotes reveal a lighter side to the formidable bowler off the field.

title: Spotlight | The man who wore an IAS mask
description: Lalit Kishor faked being an IAS officer, allegedly spending ₹5 lakh a month on convoys and staff to take bribes from at least 40 people across four States while promising them government jobs and contracts. Amarnath Tewary visits his family in Bihar, who lives in poverty, and speaks about his early aspirations

title: Doctors strike at IGMC-Shimla: CM assures review of Dr Narula’s sacking; inquiry to follow
description: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Sukhu's appeal led to the Resident Doctors Association of IGMC-Shimla ending their strike.  Following assurances of a detailed inquiry and a review of Dr. Raghav Narula's termination, doctors are set to resume duties. The CM acknowledged the strike, stating government decisions are open to review.

title: Delhi Confidential: Southern Choice
10 Indians dead fighting in Ukraine war, says man who went to Russia
description: A Jalandhar man's search for his brother in Moscow has revealed a grim reality: at least ten Indians, including three from Punjab, have died fighting for the Russian army in Ukraine, with four others missing. Jagdeep Kumar, who made two trips to Russia, has obtained official confirmation of these deaths and is now working to repatriate the bodies.

title: After Digvijaya Singh, Shashi Tharoor too says party needs to be strengthened
description: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor backed Digvijaya Singh's call for organizational strengthening and discipline within the party. Singh's earlier praise for the RSS-BJP's organizational prowess had sparked debate. Tharoor emphasized the need for a robust Congress, while Singh asserted party unity and his opposition to BJP-RSS ideology. Salman Khurshid, however, stated the Congress doesn't need to learn from the RSS.

title: Fifty years ago | Time to encourage Indian literature in English

description: The Interoceanic Train linking the states of Oaxaca and Veracruz derailed as it passed a curve near the town of Nizanda

title: ‘Doesn’t reflect facts’: Dhaka on Delhi remarks over attack on minorities
Aravalli row: Jairam Ramesh questions ministry's stance; SC to hear case today
description: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh questioned Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on the new Aravalli definition ahead of a Supreme Court hearing. He highlighted concerns about ecological integrity, citing FSI reports that emphasized the protective role of even smaller hill formations against desertification. Ramesh also pointed to past definitions and a CEC report on mining leases within the Aravallis.

title: A hundred years ago | Labour in coal mines

description: 'Consult docs, stay away from self-medication'

description: One person was killed and another was transported to a hospital with life-threatening injuries

title: 'Mystery doctor' of Dandakaranya: A shadowy figure with scalpel who’s been aiding Maoists
description: A former MBBS doctor, known as Dr. Rafiq, built a clandestine medical system for Maoists and Adivasis in Chhattisgarh's Bastar. He performed surgeries with limited resources, trained medics, and documented treatments for battlefield injuries and common ailments. Revered by locals, his network continues to function even after his departure, blending traditional knowledge with modern medicine.

title: Amit Shah's arrival in Guwahati postponed as his flight cancelled due to dense fog
description: Except for the night halt, the schedule of his programmes remains unchanged, one of the officials said

title: SC saved Aravalis for 20 yrs, and PMO on two occasions; experts slam new report
description: The Supreme Court has consistently safeguarded the Aravalis for two decades, banning mining and groundwater extraction. Despite PMO interventions to prevent dilution of construction norms in ecologically sensitive zones, recent government reports appear to favor mining. Activists highlight ongoing efforts, particularly from Haryana, to permit non-forest activities under the guise of recreation, challenging the court's conservation directives.

title: INC 140th foundation day: Congress an ideology and ideologies never die - Kharge
description: Congress celebrated its 140th foundation day with leaders asserting the party's enduring ideology.  Mallikarjun Kharge declared, "Congress is an ideology and ideologies never die," while Rahul Gandhi called it "the voice of India's soul."  The party vowed to fight for truth, courage, and the Constitution against injustice and dictatorship, urging workers to build a mass movement for MGNREGA's restoration.

title: Nearly 200 U.P. villagers get rabies shots after consuming curd from buffalo that died after dog bite
description: According to the health department, no disease has spread in the village so far, and the situation is completely normal.

title: Horoscope Today, December 29, 2025: Astrological Insights for Scorpio, Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, and Every Sun Sign
Boxing Day pitch fiasco: MCG curator in 'state of shock' at two-day Test finish
description: Batters from both sides struggled with significant sideways movement generated by the wobble seam

title: Study: Swearing lets people focus better, push beyond limit
description: New research reveals that swearing can boost physical performance by reducing self-doubt and internal hesitations.  A study found participants held challenging exercises longer when using profanity, attributing this to increased focus and pain tolerance.  This 'state disinhibition' effect allows individuals to push past mental barriers, leading to improved task execution under pressure.

title: IWT put on hold: Government clears another Chenab hydel project; follows Sawalkot nod
description: India is advancing its hydropower potential on the Chenab River with the approval of the 260 MW Dulhasti State-II project in Jammu & Kashmir. This strategic move, following the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, aims to harness the river's untapped capacity. The project, an extension of an existing facility, will contribute to India's hydropower generation goals.

title: Anjel Chakma death case: Tripura CM dials Dhami; seeks justice for 24-yr-old student
description: Tripura CM Manik Saha has urged Uttarakhand counterpart Pushkar Singh Dhami to ensure justice for Anjel Chakma, a 24-year-old student from Tripura who tragically died after a racially motivated assault in Dehradun. Five suspects are arrested, with a manhunt for a sixth underway. Authorities are also seeking a fugitive in Nepal.

title: Haryana Police draws up an expanded crime and security strategy for 2026 with a focus on violent offenders
description: The DGP directed the Special Task Force (STF) to maintain a live watchlist of 100 violent offenders across the State

title: ‘Parivar together’: Ajit Pawar announces NCP-NCP (SP) alliance for Pimpri-Chinchwad Civic polls
description: Since the NCP split in 2023, the Ajit Pawar-led NCP has been in the Mahayuti alliance with the BJP and the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena at the State level

title: 'Would you like food—or is that a bribe?': Trump mocks media — Watch video
description: Donald Trump hosted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at Mar-a-Lago, where a lighthearted moment saw Trump offering lunch to reporters, playfully questioning if it was a bribe.  The leaders discussed Zelenskyy's "20-point peace deal proposal," reportedly nearing completion. This meeting followed their earlier, more formal encounter in the Oval Office.

title: Post-Op Sindoor, DRDO transfers key camouflage, deception techs to Army
description: India's DRDO has equipped the Army with advanced camouflage software and a multispectral tank decoy to counter modern enemy detection. These technologies, developed after recent conflicts, help soldiers and equipment evade surveillance across visible, infrared, and radar spectrums. This boosts battlefield deception and survival, crucial for modern warfare.

title: Delhi govt. working to strengthen ease of doing business: CM
description: The Delhi CM claimed that in just ten months, her government has implemented several major reforms for the industrial sector

title: Now, India, Bangladesh face off over Hadi's killers
description: Bangladesh claims murder suspects of radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi have fled to Meghalaya, India. However, Indian security agencies, including the BSF and Meghalaya DGP, have strongly refuted these allegations, stating there is no evidence of any fugitive crossing the border. They dismissed the claims as fabricated and emphasized robust border surveillance.

title: Understanding the OMAD diet: How eating one meal a day affects your overall health
description: Eating just one meal a day, known as OMAD, is an extreme intermittent fasting method. While it can lead to weight loss by creating a calorie deficit and potentially boost metabolism, it carries significant risks. These include nutrient deficiencies, low energy, and potential negative impacts on health, especially if not carefully planned and supervised.

title: Arsenal stays top as Man City and Aston Villa apply the pressure and Liverpool resurgence continues
description: Villa is just a point further back in third after extending its remarkable winning run to 11 games in all competitions with a comeback 2-1 victory at Chelsea

title: PM Modi to chief secretaries: Ensure Maoism doesn’t relapse
description: Prime Minister Modi urged chief secretaries to prevent Maoism's resurgence in liberated areas by accelerating infrastructure and welfare projects. He emphasized all-round development, including rehabilitation for surrendered individuals, to ensure they remain in the mainstream. The PM also called for "deregulation cells" to boost reforms and improve ease of living and doing business.

title: Govt. to collaborate with IIT Kanpur to monitor air quality
Ministers briefed to counter Congress over VB-G RAM G; ministry sends detailed report
description: The government is preparing to defend its new rural employment scheme, VB-G RAM G, against Congress protests. Ministers have been briefed on its advantages, including 125 guaranteed workdays and durable asset creation, aiming to boost local livelihoods and curb migration.  Normative funding ensures predictable allocations, contrasting with previous models.

Srinagar house detentions: Authorities confine opposition leaders; quota row deepens in J&K
description: Authorities detained Srinagar MP Aga Ruhullah Mehdi and PDP leader Waheed Parra, halting a student protest against J&K's revised reservation policy. The changes, granting a 10% quota to Pahari-speaking people, have sparked debate over reduced open merit shares.

Brittany Mahomes shifts focus as Patrick Mahomes nears Chiefs’ final game
description: Patrick Mahomes' wife, Brittany Mahomes, has often been spotted cheering on her husband and being there for him throughout all the seasons he has played in. With this season being a huge disappointment for the Kansas City Chiefs' fans and Patrick Mahomes sustaining a brutal injury, his wife, Brittany Mahomes has made it clear what are her priorities, as the team gears up for the last match this season.

title: Logistics firm manager arrested for suspected jewellery theft
Twitch viewbotting fears rise as Cloakzy flags suspicious high-view channels
description: Popular Twitch streamer Cloakzy has highlighted a worrying trend. He observes many new streamers suddenly attracting huge viewer numbers, sparking questions about viewbotting. This comes as Twitch has been trying to combat fake viewership. Cloakzy's comments suggest the problem may still be prevalent, impacting fair competition for legitimate content creators on the platform.

title: Wade Barrett and Haley Bennett combined net worth in 2025 explored
description: Wrestler Wade Barrett and actress Haley Bennett, despite different career beginnings, showcase how persistence and flexibility shape financial stability. Barrett leveraged his WWE fame into commentary and action films, while Bennett built a Hollywood career through diverse roles. Both demonstrate evolving income streams beyond their initial breakouts, with net worth estimates reflecting their varied professional journeys.

Badminton nationals: 14-year-old Tanvi Patri goes down against local favourite Surya Charishma but walks away with rich praise from PV Sindhu
On the roof of the world, feral dogs hunt down Ladakh’s rare species
description: Ladakh's pristine cold desert faces a crisis as feral dogs, numbering nearly 45,000, threaten endangered wildlife like snow leopards and Pallas's cats.  Human activities, including increased tourism and unmanaged waste, have fueled their rapid multiplication.  Conservationists warn these canines, now outnumbering native predators, pose a significant ecological threat and have even attacked humans.

title: District Police Chief promises proper probe into bike accident

'Terrific meeting': Trump on Russia-Ukraine peace talks with Zelenskyy — top developments
description: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy briefed UK PM Starmer on frontline updates and preparations for his meeting with US President Trump. Trump also spoke with Russian President Putin ahead of the talks, with both sides reportedly agreeing a ceasefire could prolong the conflict. EU leaders reaffirmed support for Ukraine, as Zelenskyy prepares to present his peace proposal.

title: US: 1 dead as two helicopters collide mid-air; video shows thick smoke
description: Two helicopters collided mid-air and crashed in Hammonton, New Jersey, with one aircraft fully engulfed in flames. Emergency crews are on scene, actively extricating at least one patient from the wreckage. The investigation is ongoing, and the public is urged to avoid the area.

description: Festive fairs, sacred temples and desert adventures define a day in Pushkar that draws travellers year after year.

Watch: Pakistan President Zardari reveals he was advised to ‘hide in a bunker’ during Operation Sindoor
description: Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari has revealed that he was advised to hide in a bunker when India launched Operation Sindoor in May. Speaking at an event marking the 18th death anniversary of former Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto, Zardari recalled the tense moments during the India-Pakistan military escalation and praised Army chief Asim Munir’s response.

title: Dense smog engulfs Delhi-NCR: Orange alert issued amid poor visibility; flight ops affected
description: Delhi-NCR is battling a severe smog crisis, with visibility plummeting and air quality entering the 'very poor' category.  Dense fog has led to flight disruptions at IGI Airport, operating under CAT III conditions.  Authorities have implemented GRAP Stage III curbs, including construction bans and 'No PUC, No Fuel' rules, as cold temperatures exacerbate the pollution.

description: A man fatally stabbed nine people, including five children, in Paramaribo, Suriname, overnight. Police responded by shooting the suspect, who sustained leg wounds and was taken into custody. Two others, a child and an adult, were seriously injured and hospitalized.

description: Power couple Jake Paul and Jutta Leerdam boast a combined net worth of $205 million in 2025.  Paul's wealth stems from boxing and business ventures, while Leerdam's comes from Olympic speed skating and sponsorships. Both are actively pursuing their respective careers, with Paul recently engaging in high-profile boxing matches and Leerdam preparing for upcoming international events.

title: Aaron Rodgers explains why he keeps his wife private amid marriage mystery
description: The Pittsburgh Steelers' star player and the NFL veteran, Aaron Rodgers' marriage has become a topic of discussion among fans for the last few months, ever since he announced that he has tied the knot. While fans troll him, Aaron Rodgers has opened up about why he will not be bringing his wife in the spotlight even if that means getting trolled.

title: 'Thought I was next Steve Jobs': Google founder shares lesson from early days
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin shared a key lesson learned from the Google Glass failure, advising entrepreneurs to fully develop their ideas before public stunts. He admitted to rushing commercialization and aiming for a "Steve Jobs moment" prematurely.

title: Ex-Tesla's AI director Andrej Karpathy warns programmers of falling behind
description: Tesla's ex-AI chief, Andrej Karpathy, warns software engineers face a seismic shift as AI reshapes coding. He admits feeling behind, highlighting a new 'programmable layer' of AI tools. While some studies show mixed productivity gains, industry leaders like Google and Anthropic remain optimistic about AI's role in development.

title: Brittany Mahomes looks past Chiefs struggles; praises Patrick’s off-field impact
description: Patrick Mahomes' 15 and the Mahomies Foundation is making a significant community impact, with partner Youth Volunteer Corps reporting over 92,000 volunteer hours and $3.2 million in community benefit. Brittany Mahomes actively supports these efforts, highlighting the foundation's growing influence beyond football.  The foundation's initiatives, like Read for 15 and Volunteer for 15, foster positive development in young people.
